I'm not exactly sure what you are asking about, but I'll try to answer.
 
T=
he ToeThreads do not handle duplicate detection. This is done in the
Fronti=
er. Basically, the ToeThreads exectue extractor processors (that
discover n=
ew URIs) and handle scoping of them (to see if we want to crawl
them). The =
discovered URIs are then passed to the Frontier which ultimately
decides th=
eir fate. Typically, if the URI matches one that has already been
added to =
the Frontier, then the new instance is discarded.
 
The same URI should nev=
er be entered twice into the processing queues of the
BdbFrontier. There ar=
e some exceptions, in that DNS and robots.txt
information expires and is re=
fetched at certain intervals. Also, there is an
alternative ARFrontier that=
 reschedules all URIs.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf O=
f callforshadab
Sent: 3. n=F3vember 2005 07:30
To: archive-crawler@yahoogro=
ups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] duplicacy in URIs....


Hi,
I want to kn=
ow that how heretrix stops toeThreads from copying the
already seen URIs in=
 FrontierDB.

is there any chance of DUPLICACY OF URIs in Database.

with r=
egards,
shadab
